comment: prof! Took this Spring 2025. Quizzes/exams were on paper. In-class & group activities. He loves teaching. If he says read the book—read it or at least engage & take notes or you'll struggle, esp. on exams (MC & written). PowerPoints on D2L. He closes assignments after due dates, so save details early! QUIZZES AND EXAMS ARE PAPER LOL.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Story is energetic and humorous, making lectures engaging and easy to follow. However, feedback was often missing on major assignments, and grading transparency was limited. If you're looking for clear feedback or flexibility, you may want to reconsider. Proceed but with caution! I received a 68.62 and he did not want to make it a 70 lol.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Attendance was mandatory, 6 essays, in person quizzes & exams. Exams were fill in the blank & essay formatted. Gave us extra credit because most of us would fail the quizzes/exams. He simply takes this class too serious, being that it's an elective. Study guides were over a page long & you have to search for the answers to them. Wouldn't take again

His guidelines were unclear the entire semester. He had us create our own syllabus and then refused to release it until after the deadline to drop the class. Attendance was not mandatory but there were unclear dates for quizzes so it was best to show up. Great guy, really chill, but did not care about teaching us anything. I really don't recommend!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Highly recommend him. He is very helpful but it took me hours a day doing online work for this class. Everything is expected by hand and showing alot of work, please watch the videos and use the textbook because it will be very helpful. Took the four week summer session and it goes by fast so keep up with the work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: An excellent professor that cares about student success.
Read the textbook, come to class, take notes, participate in class, and you will be fine. An easy B or C. 1200-word mini research paper guarantees you an A.

One of the most flexible and nicest professors on campus. Read the textbook & if you are having issues with any assignments meet with him after class. He is very transparent and student friendly. You must read the textbook & review the power point he provides, & you will easily pass his class. You will struggle if you do not read the textbook.

By your effort, class attendance, taking notes, reading the textbook and completing the assignments (discussion post) you will receive an excellent grade. IF YOU READ THE TEXTBOOK...except an B or A no less than a C.  He is a really cool professor. Very easy to talk to and gives you instant feedback on how well you are doing in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Dr. Story is fantastic! If you put in the work you will not only pass the class but have a good understanding of the stats needed for research/work in psychology. He is very helpful and has a lot of resources available fi youa re struggling, you just have to use them. I cannot recommend him enough
Very flexible, transparent, and laid-back professor that cares about his students.
One of the best professors on campus. He is very knowledgeable, transparent and caring.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: Very understanding professor. He definitely relates to college students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: He gives you an opportunity to retake or make up exams, discussion post, and writing assignments. No professor I ever had provided me with that opportunity. He definitely cares about you as a student and person. I failed my initial exam one and he allow me the opportunity to retake it and I passed.
Just read the textbook, take notes and come to class. You will pass, it's that simple.
Excellent Professor.....definetly one of the best professor I have ever had.

Professor Story is one of the best Professors at KSU, very flexible, understanding and transparent. He cares about your feedback and response to your email and encourages students to ask questions. I could have earned an A or B in this class easily but, I choose to earn an C in this class bc I did not want to complete the 1200-word paper.

Great teacher and lectures, I've taken him for 3 classes including intro and stat app, and it was a good class every time. It's hard to get a good grade but it wasn't a hard grade I was mad about. Take him at least once especially if you're a PSYC major.
Lots of rambling during lecture videos. He also does not give clear directions for assignments.

Dr. Story teaches a tough class but does a great job doing it. Cares about students & their success and it shows. Lets students create their own syllabus & grading criteria the first week. Some people can be condescending when teaching tough material but he isn't at all. This is not an easy class but he does a good job helping you to understand it.
There is no way I will take this professor again. He doesn't care much about students and assumes you know everything. Very harsh grader.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Story is one of the best Professors I have ever taken! His lectures were incredibly helpful, grading criteria were clear and fair. I took a 4-week summer class, and I spent probably 6 hours a day on this class, it is EXTREMELY tough, but Dr. Story makes it understandable and engaging - Heads up though, everything is expected to be done by hand.
Professor Story knows his material well and is passionate about statistics. He is very kind and helpful, but he teaches at a fast pace and it feels like you are never caught up. Final is optional.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: Not a very good teacher, only teaches the bare minimum, does not go over material very well, and has a hard time getting you to grasp the fine points.

Dr. Story is passionate about his teaching which makes his lectures easy to listen to. Your class will make your own schedule so don't ask for more work than you can handle. The quizzes and tests are easy, the homework on the other hand is time consuming. He grades tough so you'll want to read the textbook very thoroughly to get full credit.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: has you "create your own syllabus" without knowing what the class consists of yet, aka how many quizzes and tests you want but you are unaware of how much content will be covered in each one, offers to "check" answers for homework and assignments for halfcredit back if the answer is wrong but that also means half credit if it is right and he checks

Took for PSYC3000, but wasn't available to select. Stats Apps is a hard class but Professor Story made the class enjoyable and easy for me. You have to attend class to do well, but it is so worth it. He cares about making sure we fully understand the concepts and allows wiggle room in grading and class structure.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I loved his lectures! He makes each lecture interesting which makes it easy to pay attention. Weekly assignments and test where really easy. I recommend taking notes during the lecture, I only studied my notes and did well on tests. I would definitely take him again!

Compared to the PSYC 2103 professor I have now, Story was AMAZING! He graded on weekly hw, quizzes, and 3 exams with an optional final. The subject on its own is heavy but not hard and he at least makes the material interesting. He made me love Psychology
His 3.5/5 on here is pretty accurate. That's all I'd really say to describe his teaching. He's okay. Great dude though with some awesome stories.

He was the best professor ive ever had, im taking my second psyc class now and i miss him so much. Each day is a lecture but he actually made them interesting by being funny in my opinion, stories, and fun activities. Theres quizzes and hw every week but theyre super easy as long as you pay attention and stay on top of doing them to get the credit.

Professor Story is absolutely amazing. He isn't just a great professor but you can tell, as a person, he really cares about his students. There are 4 tests throughout the semester and one is the final (which can be skipped). There's a quiz every week but it's online, and as long as you pay attention, you'll do perfectly fine.

The class is not that hard. All work is due weekly through Launchpad and includes textbook reading/quizzes each week. However, its only graded on completion so if you do the work each week you will get a good grade. Other than that, there are only a few tests. Powerpoints basically every class & some fun participation experiments.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This man think he a math teacher when it come to test we took to many dang exams and he take his job to serious Fr . Please dont take him dont listen to them other students
rating_tags: Tough grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Story was a very good Intro to Psychology teacher. He was very passionate about Psych and often included stories and fun activities in his lectures. There was a lot of homework and weekly quizzes, however, if you pay attention and take notes you should do well.

Professor Story is a great teacher but I struggled to get a low B in this class. He is a VERY intelligent man but sometimes thinks we are at his level when we are not. The HW is very easy and helps your grade a lot. His tests are 60+ questions and there is A LOT of content on them. Lectures every class but is interesting most of the time.

An easy A. Hes kind of eccentric but you can tell hes very passionate about psychology so lectures were never super boring. There are weekly, mini true or false quizzes and chapter homework that if youre paying attention can only boost your grade. The test didnt go off script and covered what was said in class. 10/10 would recommend.

I used to not like Story, but deep down he is actually a good teacher. If you don't want to show up to class you can still pass because he does live zoom lectures as well. The homework is easy and he does fun activities during lecture. Only issue is his tests are 60 questions & it covers 4-5 chapters which is a lot of content for 1 test

Dr. Story is an amazing person and his lectures are fun and educational. He is a graduate professor, so if you take an undergraduate class with him, be prepared to do graduate level work. He gave us way too many assignments, and graded them very toughly, but if you can handle the work, he's definitely worth taking.

I love this man! He is probably the most underrated psych teacher at KSU. Experimental is a hard class and he broke everything down for us to really understand. Research paper is split into sections so it's easy to get done. You get to create your own syllabus too. He really cares about your learning and is super passionate. Take him!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pstory is amazing!! His lectures are clear and interesting and class goes by fast. He is super helpful and encourages everyone to go to his office hours for help. The class itself is difficult but he makes it as bearable as possible. Hes the best psych teacher Ive had so far at KSU.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: he lets the class write the syllabus. he gives a lot of papers but doesn't grade too hard. quizzes and tests are easy. he is nice and passionate about the subject and keeps it real with the students. learned a lot, easy A, would take again
He's often happy, a bit funny, and passionate about the content. The graduate assistants' graded the papers and they graded very hard.
LOVED his class!! Learned so much; however, it isn't an easy A. Prepare to work for your A.... but COMPLETELY worth it!

Hes a nice guy and I respect him as a professor. I struggled very greatly in this class. I studied day and night just to get by. Felt as though you have to be the kind of person who's naturally very very intelligent to keep up. Lectures are difficult and the class itself is hard enough. He's nice but do yourself a favor and take someone else.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tests are tough

comment: Story is kind and intelligent, but his exams/ quizzes are a little difficult. His lectures are given on the basic level and his exams are worded hard, have computations, and short essays. He expects a lot, but isn't awful.

He's incredibly difficult but listens to his students. The class will get an option to make the syllabus but be careful how you decide to create it. He's a difficult grader but once you are not understanding the concepts, go for help ASAP.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Cares whether or not students learn the material, grades somewhat harshly but is a p chill guy. Would recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Material discussed in class is interesting, easy to understand (if you pay attention), and presented in ways that make the information applicable to life beyond academia. Prepare to understand the material conceptually and expect to write. Classes can be challenging; however, he provides ample opportunity to succeed. Highly Recommend Dr. Story!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: You don't have to live and breathe his material to pass, but he does expect you to know general applications of material covered. Memorizing definitions just won't cut it. That being said, he gives plenty of applicable examples during class and his tests generally do not deviate from in-class notes. Go to class and apply the material. Great prof.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I'm going to tell an actual students point of view. He an extremely tough grader, he seems annoyed when you go to him. If and when you get a C on your 1st paper and/or test don't become shocked when his response isn't logical. To help you avoid him! if you have a chance... take someone else or even wait! The heartache is not worth it, nor is the C

Dr. Story really cares about his students. Make sure you attend class and read the textbook at least the night before. If you have a question in class, just ask. Make sure you take advantage of all the resources he offers. He gives students a lot of options early on to succeed. His tests are difficult and are not vocabulary based. Study hard.

Go to class and do the work. Basically, be a decent student and care about what you're learning and you won't have any problems getting an A or B. Story WANTS you to learn and succeed. His classes aren't easy so I guess its the students that expected to coast that gave the bad reviews. Gives extra credit, answers all questions, very helpful.

I really can't believe that there are such negative comments about Dr. Story. He is by far my favorite professor and I've encountered many in my five years at KSU. I've had him for multiple classes and I strongly recommend him! He is passionate about making sure you understand the material. Ask questions and go to class and you'll do great!

Dr. Story not only taught me about experimental psychology, but we also had lots of helpful conversations about grad school and other major life-school decisions and the best way to approach them. He really does care about his students.. Show him you care and put as much effort as he does into the class and you'll be a better person better for it.

I do not know how this man has such poor reviews. I have absolutely loved his classes (yes, I've taken multiple.) He is incredibly helpful and always has extra credit. The most accommodating teacher I've met. Excellent in office hours. Tough, but you actually learn instead of memorizing.  Signed up for more with him. Very happy I gave him a chance.

The class content itself was easy (you can follow the book). He taught in the most bizarre way; he made the content seem confusing. Class attendance was a joke, it was a 3 h and 45 min lecture! There was no involvement, which made the class even more boring. If there is another professor offered take them. I would not recommend him.

This man is on a different scale of difficulty, it would be fine if there was some extra help but since in this school when you get to experimental not even the pysch lab or math lab is of any help. I don't want to do this again so i'll be happy with a C. Even right now i don't even think that a C would be possible.

Tests were half multiple choice and half essay. As long as you read the chapters you will do well on the tests. He's very interested in how students feel about is lectures and gives out a course evaluation halfway through the semester. There was one group project, 2 papers and a few homework assignments.
This class is difficult without a doubt, but Dr. Story makes it even harder. He does not answer questions thoroughly. I made C on all the test. Not very helpful. I would not take him ever again.
Dr. Story was a great professor. He always helps if you have extra questions.  You do need to show up to class because the lectures are written out on the board.

Seems to be a cool guy, but I swear he doesn't give out As. Lectures are pretty interesting, and notes are on the board so you have to attend. One paper and one group presentation. Tests are half MC, half essay.

I took this proffesor for research methods and social and no lies its not an easy A. He doesnt assign a lot of work but you cant pass without awesome notes. Tests are all from the lecture and are HARD. But if you want to actually learn from the material and use what you learned in the real world he's your guy. Hell go out of your way to help you.

RUN! One of the hardest classes and professors I have ever taken and I'm graduating. Maymester=16 discussion postings EVERY SINGLE week, 1 test per week (HARD, timed),1 four page paper per week. Grades are inconsistent and harsh, workload is insane. I am a great student and this class was too much for me and my fellow classmates. Just don't.

This class was pretty difficult. I didnâ€™t have as hard as a time as others, but the tests were still hard to pass. He is a little confusing, but will explain it in different ways if asked. Take advantage of his office hours and ask for help on the paper if you need it! I got an A on the paper since I picked something interesting and got his help.

Dr. Story is an amazing teacher if it wasn't for the extra credit assignments I would be retaking this class. He is great with getting assignments back on time, updating grades and emailing you back asap. He is just a really tough grader and the test are super hard. You def need to know stats if you are taking him. Please attend class if u take him

Professor Story is a cool guy, but puts way too much information on the test and grades homework/tests really tough. You have to know stats on your own in order to pass his class. I'm doing decent in this class, but could be doing a lot better if he actually summarized what will be on the test instead of saying 'everything goes, good luck'.
Ridiculously difficult... it's super upsetting. Nice man and knows what he's teaching, but grades so harshly. Feels impossible to pass!

If you are taking Research Methods, DO NOT TAKE PROFESSOR STORY. This class is hard and he only made it worse. Not good with getting grades back quickly, not helpful, very confusing, and tough grader. Do not take his class unless you are able to completly teach yourself everything, because you will not learn in this class. Most got lower than a C.
